alert.note: Alert for Pike (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 2:01PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Sullivan and Pike Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 201 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greeley, or 7 miles northwest of Montague, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shohola, Matamoras, Milford, Oakland, Glen Spey, Greeley, Pecks Pond, Dingmans Ferry, Millrift and Twin Lakes. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 84 between 34 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
